awd_titl_txt: Synoptic-Climatological Studies of Precipitation Regimes in Venezuela
awd_abstract_narration: The investigators will analyze geostationary and polar orbiting                 satellite data as well as climatological station data for the period            1976-1985 examine the causes and consequences of precipitation regimes          in Venezuela.  By determining why the seasonal march of precipitation in        Venezuela differs sharply from that in other tropical regions,                  especially monsoon areas, the project will increase our understanding of        the climatology of a region with a unique precipitation regime, of its          possible teleconnections with events and processes outside the study            region, and our knowledge of tropical climatology more generally.  The          results of the project will also serve as a benchmark for future studies        of topographic effects on climate in the study area and for other               geoecological and paleoclimatic investigations.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Behavioral and Cognitive Sciences
